thread.title: Police sniff cannabis fumes from passing car
thread.title_full: Police sniff cannabis fumes from passing car

title: Police sniff cannabis fumes from passing car
text: comments A drug-driver was collared on the motorway after his cannabis fumes were so strong - they drifted into a passing police patrol car. Jeffrey Chandler, 53, was zooming at 90mph on the M6 near Penrith, Cumbria, when he rocketed past a police patrol vehicle last June. But Carlisle Crown Court heard the cannabis smoke fumes billowing out of his Volkswagen Golf that it wafted through the vents of the officer's vehicle behind. Judge Andrew Shaw said the drug readings indicated a 'staggeringly high level of cocaine use' Now Chandler has narrowly avoided jail after he tested positive for class A and B drugs - and found to be 40 times the drug-drive limit. Judge Andrew Shaw said the drug readings indicated a 'staggeringly high level of cocaine use'. RELATED ARTICLES
